question: In what year did World War II end?
description: The war officially ended on September 2, 1945, with the signing of the Japanese Instrument of Surrender.

question: In what year did the United States declare independence from Great Britain?
description: The Declaration of Independence was adopted by the Continental Congress on July 4, 1776.

question: In what year did Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walk on the moon?
description: Apollo 11 landed on the moon on July 20, 1969.

question: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?
description: The wall fell on November 9, 1989, marking the end of the Cold War.

question: In what year did the Titanic sink?
description: The Titanic sank on April 15, 1912, after hitting an iceberg.

question: In what year did the first iPhone come out?
description: The first iPhone was released on June 29, 2007.

question: In what year was William Shakespeare born?
description: Shakespeare was born on April 26, 1564, in Stratford-upon-Avon, England.

question: In what year did the first modern Olympic Games take place?
description: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, from April 6 to April 15, 1896.

question: In what year did the Soviet Union launch the first artificial satellite, Sputnik 1?
description: Sputnik 1 was launched on October 4, 1957, marking the beginning of the Space Age.

question: In what year did the first Star Wars movie come out?
description: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope was released on May 25, 1977.

question: In what year did the United States enter World War I?
description: The United States declared war on Germany on April 6, 1917.

question: In what year did the Spanish Civil War start?
description: The Spanish Civil War began on July 17, 1936, and lasted until April 1, 1939.

question: In what year did the European Union form?
description: The European Union was officially formed with the signing of the Maastricht Treaty on November 1, 1993.

question: In what year did the first successful powered flight take place?
description: The Wright brothers achieved the first successful powered flight on December 17, 1903, in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.

question: In what year did the first modern computer, ENIAC, become operational?
description: The Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer (ENIAC) was completed and became operational on February 15, 1945.

question: In what year did the Chernobyl nuclear disaster occur?
description: The Chernobyl nuclear disaster occurred on April 26, 1986, at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine.

question: In what year did the first successful heart transplant take place?
description: Dr. Christiaan Barnard performed the first successful heart transplant on December 3, 1967, in Cape Town, South Africa.

question: In what year did the first successful human flight with a jetpack occur?
description: The first successful human flight with a jetpack occurred on April 21, 1961, when Harold Graham flew for 13 seconds in Bell Aerosystems' rocket belt.

question: In what year did the United Nations formally come into existence?
description: The United Nations officially came into existence on October 24, 1945, with the signing of the UN Charter by 51 countries.

question: In what year did the Vietnam War end?
description: The Vietnam War officially ended on April 30, 1975, when North Vietnam captured Saigon (now Ho Chi Minh City), the capital of South Vietnam.

question: In what year did the first successful organ transplant occur?
description: The first successful organ transplant occurred on December 23, 1954, when Dr. Joseph Murray performed a kidney transplant between identical twins.

question: In what year did the first successful cloning of a mammal, Dolly the sheep, take place?
description: Dolly the sheep was successfully cloned on July 5, 1996, at the Roslin Institute in Scotland.

question: In what year was the city of Rome founded?
description: According to tradition, the city of Rome was founded on April 21, 753 BC.

question: In what year did the construction of Stonehenge begin?
description: The construction of Stonehenge, a prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, England, began around 3000 BC.

question: In what year was the Hanging Gardens of Babylon built?
description: The Hanging Gardens of Babylon, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, were built around 600 BC.

question: In what year did the Buddha live?
description: The Buddha, also known as Siddhartha Gautama, was born in Lumbini, Nepal, in 563 BC and died in 483 BC.

question: In what year did the ancient Olympic Games begin?
description: The ancient Olympic Games, which were held in Olympia, Greece, began in 776 BC and continued until 393 AD.

question: In what year was the city of Alexandria, Egypt founded?
description: The city of Alexandria, Egypt, was founded by Alexander the Great in 331 BC.

question: In what year was the Colossus of Rhodes built?
description: The Colossus of Rhodes, a statue of the Greek god Helios that stood over 30 meters (98 feet) tall, was built around 280 BC and was destroyed in an earthquake in 226 BC.

question: In what year did Julius Caesar die?
description: Julius Caesar, the Roman dictator, was assassinated on March 15, 44 BC.

question: In what year was the Great Pyramid of Giza built?
description: The Great Pyramid of Giza, the oldest and largest of the three pyramids in the Giza pyramid complex, was built around 2560 BC.

question: In what year was the Code of Hammurabi written?
description: The Code of Hammurabi, a well-preserved Babylonian law code of ancient Mesopotamia, was written around 1754 BC.

question: In what year did Julius Caesar become the dictator of Rome?
description: Julius Caesar became the dictator of Rome in 44 BC after defeating his rival, Pompey, in a civil war.

question: In what year did the Roman Empire officially split into the Eastern and Western empires?
description: In 395 AD, the Roman Empire officially split into the Eastern Roman Empire (later known as the Byzantine Empire) and the Western Roman Empire.

question: In what year did the Black Death begin to spread throughout Europe?
description: The Black Death, a deadly pandemic caused by the bubonic plague, began to spread throughout Europe in 1347 and ultimately resulted in the deaths of millions of people.

question: In what year did the Protestant Reformation begin?
description: The Protestant Reformation began in 1517 when Martin Luther published his Ninety-Five Theses, which criticized the practices and beliefs of the Roman Catholic Church.

question: In what year did the Industrial Revolution begin?
description: The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the mid-18th century and eventually spread to other parts of Europe, North America, and the world.

question: In what year did World War I begin?
description: World War I began in 1914 after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary by a Serbian nationalist.

question: In what year did the Russian Revolution take place?
description: The Russian Revolution took place in 1917 and ultimately resulted in the establishment of the Soviet Union.

question: In what year did the United States enter World War II?
description: The United States entered World War II in 1941 after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

question: In what year did the Universal Declaration of Human Rights come into existence?
description: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights was adopted by the United Nations General Assembly on December 10, 1948.

question: In what year did the Soviet Union dissolve?
description: The Soviet Union dissolved on December 26, 1991, after a period of political and economic turmoil.

question: In what year did the Treaty of Versailles end World War I?
description: The Treaty of Versailles, which formally ended World War I, was signed on June 28, 1919, in the Hall of Mirrors at the Palace of Versailles, France.

question: In what year did the first modern postage stamp, the Penny Black, go into circulation?
description: The Penny Black, the first adhesive postage stamp, was issued in Britain on May 1, 1840, and featured an image of Queen Victoria.

question: In what year was the Great Fire of London?
description: The Great Fire of London burned for four days from September 2 to September 6, 1666, destroying much of the city and leaving an estimated 100,000 people homeless.

question: In what year was the Mona Lisa painted?
description: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci between 1503 and 1506.

question: In what year did the Black Death first arrive in Europe?
description: The Black Death, also known as the bubonic plague, first arrived in Europe in 1347 and went on to kill an estimated 25 million people, or about a third of the continent's population.

question: In what year did the Industrial Revolution begin?
description: The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the mid-18th century, around 1760, and eventually spread to other parts of the world.

question: In what year did the first modern atlas, the Atlas Novus, by Willem Janszoon Blaeu, get published?
description: The Atlas Novus, a collection of maps of the world and the heavens, was published by Dutch cartographer Willem Janszoon Blaeu in 1635.

question: In what year did the construction of the Great Wall of China begin?
description: The construction of the Great Wall of China began in the 7th century BC, but the most famous sections of the wall were built during the Ming dynasty, starting in the 14th century AD. The year -214 is the approximate date of the first recorded mention of the wall, in a text by the ancient Chinese historian Sima Qian.

question: In what year did the Battle of Marathon take place?
description: The Battle of Marathon was fought in 490 BC between the Athenians and the Persian Empire. The Athenians were victorious and the battle is considered a pivotal moment in the development of Western civilization.

question: In what year did the United States invade Afghanistan?
description: The United States invaded Afghanistan on October 7, 2001, in response to the September 11 terrorist attacks. The conflict is still ongoing

question: In what year did the Battle of Hastings take place?
description: The Battle of Hastings was fought on October 14, 1066, between the Norman-French army of William, the Duke of Normandy, and the English army of King Harold II. The Normans were victorious, and William became King of England, marking the beginning of the Norman Conquest.

question: In what year did the Black Death reach its peak mortality in Europe?
description: The Black Death reached its peak mortality in Europe in 1348, when it killed an estimated 50 million people, or about 60% of the population.

question: In what year did Christopher Columbus make his first voyage to the Americas?
description: Christopher Columbus set sail on his first voyage to the Americas on August 3, 1492, with three ships: the Santa Maria, the Pinta, and the Niña. He arrived in the Bahamas on October 12 of that year.

question: In what year did the American Civil War end?
description: The American Civil War ended on April 9, 1865, when Confederate General Robert E. Lee surrendered to Union General Ulysses S. Grant at the Appomattox Court House in Virginia.

question: In what year did Julius Caesar cross the Rubicon River?
description: In 49 BC, Julius Caesar led his army across the Rubicon River, which was the border between Italy and Gaul (modern-day France). This act was seen as a declaration of war against the Roman Republic and ultimately led to Caesar's rise to power.

question: In what year did the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza begin?
description: The Great Pyramid of Giza was built as a tomb for the pharaoh Khufu and construction began around 2560 BC. It is the oldest and largest of the three pyramids in Giza, and one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

question: In what year did the Zhou dynasty begin in China?
description: The Zhou dynasty is believed to have begun in 1046 BC after overthrowing the Shang dynasty, and is considered one of the longest-lasting dynasties in Chinese history.

question: In what year was the ancient city of Rome founded?
description: According to legend, the ancient city of Rome was founded in 753 BC by twin brothers Romulus and Remus. Rome went on to become one of the most powerful and influential cities in the ancient world.

question: In what year did the Peloponnesian War begin?
description: The Peloponnesian War was fought between Athens and Sparta and their respective allies from 431 to 404 BC. The war was one of the most significant events in ancient Greek history, and had a profound impact on the development of Western civilization.

question: In what year did the construction of Stonehenge begin?
description: Stonehenge is a prehistoric monument in England, and the construction of the stones is believed to have begun around 3000 BC. The purpose of the monument is still unknown, but it is believed to have been a site of religious or ceremonial significance.

question: In what year did the ancient city of Babylon fall to the Persians?
description: The ancient city of Babylon fell to the Persian Empire in 539 BC after a siege led by Cyrus the Great. Babylon had been one of the most important cities in the ancient world, and its fall marked the end of the Neo-Babylonian Empire.

question: In what year did Alexander the Great become king of Macedon?
description: Alexander the Great became king of Macedon in 336 BC after the assassination of his father, King Philip II.
